li.a: How to Effectively Communicate with School Officials
National Association for the Education of Young Children

td.a: Remote Learning Plan - Update from Dr. Crader 4.23.20

img.br:
Dear Parents/Guardians:
At this time, there are no new updates with regard to schools reopening. We will continue in remote learning mode until further notice. We are in the process of planning for any scenario, including the possibility of remaining closed. Our Principals are aware of all that needs to occur before the school year’s end and will communicate plans when appropriate. Be assured that our team meets regularly, albeit remotely, to discuss plans and procedures. I thank you for your continued patience. As always, please reach out to your child’s teacher, principal, or to my office should you need assistance of any kind. Please check this site regularly and take advantage of the many resources listed. I hope this letter finds you and your family healthy and well during this trying time.
Sincerely,
Dr. Crader
Superintendent, Neptune Township Schools

Being faced with an unprecedented situation, your input is extremely important for our planning. Please take a few minutes to complete the survey questions below. Thank you for your time and please stay well.

td.a: Important Message for our Graduating Seniors!

img.br:
Attention Neptune High School Seniors: We have not forgotten you! We know that senior milestones are important and are considering options for prom, yearbooks, graduation, etc., depending on the scenarios we may face. As soon as possible, we will communicate those plans to you. For now, feel free to reach out to your teachers, counselor, or Principal/Vice Principal with any concerns or questions. Stay strong!
Dr. Crader
Superintendent Neptune Twp Schools

td.a: Remote Learning - Update to Chromebooks Camera

img.br:
This letter is to inform you of an upcoming change to your child(ren)’s district-issued Chromebook. As you may be aware, the camera on your child(ren)’s district-issued Chromebook was disabled when your child(ren) received the device, meaning that your child(ren) could not use the camera to record video, take a photograph, video conference, etc.
Given the extraordinary circumstances facing the district during this state-wide shutdown, teachers and educational service professionals are looking for creative ways to engage with their students. As a result, the district will be activating the camera on your child(ren)’s district-issued device to allow for remote learning activities that include video conferencing. If your child(ren) has a district-issued Chromebook at home, please read on.

td.a: How to Register Your Child During the Health Emergency

img.br:
1. Complete the online pre-registration application located on our website – www.neptuneschools.org
2. Once completed, contact the Registrar at 732-776-2200, ext. 3634. Leave a message indicating that your application has been completed and include your name, your child’s name and a phone number where you can be reached.
3. The Registrar will contact you to review the pre-registration application and collect additional information.
4. The Registrar will review required documentation with you; birth certificate, proof of residency, guardianship (if necessary), school records including IEP (if applicable) and medical records. Additional documentation may be requested.
5. Once the required documents are submitted and approved, the registration will be complete and the school your child will attend will reach out to you.
If you have questions or special registration needs, please leave a voice message at: 732-776-2200 ext. 3634
If you are registering a new preschooler who will start school in September, you will be contacted regarding the rescheduled School Tours and Lottery drawing, if this is needed.

td.a: Aquatic Summer Camp Registration Now Open

img.br: The NAC's 2020 Aquatic Adventures Camp, designed for swimmers age 7 - 13 runs Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays in July and August. The camp consists of two days per week at the NAC and one trip per week for different aquatic activities. Trips typically include Kayaking, Junior Guard, Water Park exploration, Sandy Hook Marine Marsh Trip Exploration and Surfing with Family Beach day.You can sign up now for the 7 weeks or for individual weeks but must select a minimum of 2 weeks. Click Here to Login and Register Today!

Champions is the flexible, adventure filled way to spend summer break. Discover new interests on field trips and make new friends with hands on activities all day. No matter where kids are enrolled in school, they can enjoy summer camp with their friends at Champions. Choose any location that's best for you, and let's have fun!
Together we form a strong partnership to ensure that all Neptune Students receive and exceptional education. Go to http://sot.ag/7XkPK to join!
